newsitem.title: UK: Brussels to clear BT, MCI merger on Wednesday.
newsitem.headline: Brussels to clear BT, MCI merger on Wednesday.

text.p: The European Commission will on Wednesday clear the 12 billion pound ($20 billion) merger between British Telecommunications Plc and America's second long-distance carrier, MCI Communications Corp, BBC radio reported.

European Competition Commissioner Karl Van Miert told BBC radio in an interview to be broadcast on Tuesday night that Brussels regulators were poised to clear the biggest transatlatic merger in history.
Brussels to clear BT, MCI merger on Wednesday
"Tomorrow the Commission will certainly take a positive decision on the BT/MCI (deal)...There has been a very positive co-operation," van Miert told BBC Radio 5 Live's Financial World Tonight.

With clearance assured from Brussels, the merger's last remaining hurdle is U.S. regulators. BT, which declined to comment before being officially notified of the Commission's decision, is confident of winning definitive approval by autumn.
Van Miert said that BT had offered solutions to two problems identified by the competition regulators and that therefore, the case had been handled swiftly.

"BT has been very positive, forthcoming, open-minded about it and put its cards on the table. We identified two problems and they were offering almost immediately the right answers to the problems -- so we said okay, we can go ahead," van Miert told the BBC.
